title: 2001 MBNA Platinum 400
text:
The 2001 MBNA Platinum 400 was a <a href="NASCAR">NASCAR</a> <a href="Sprint%20Cup%20Series">Winston Cup Series</a> racing event held on June 3, 2001, at <a href="Dover%20International%20Speedway">Dover Downs International Speedway</a> in <a href="Dover%2C%20Delaware">Dover</a>, <a href="Delaware">Delaware</a>.
Qualifying was rained out, and Dale Jarrett would start on pole.
Contested over 400 laps, it was the thirteenth race of the <a href="2001%20NASCAR%20Winston%20Cup%20Series">2001 season</a>. <a href="Jeff%20Gordon">Jeff Gordon</a> of <a href="Hendrick%20Motorsports">Hendrick Motorsports</a> took his second win of the season leading 381 out of the 400 laps, while <a href="Steve%20Park">Steve Park</a> finished second and <a href="Dale%20Earnhardt%2C%20Jr.">Dale Earnhardt, Jr.</a> finished third. Jarrett retained his points lead but was reduced from 75 points to 50.
Sixteen lead changes were made in this 199-minute event. While the average green flag run was almost 62 laps, more than 7% of the race was held under a caution flag.
Report.
Background.
<a href="Dover%20International%20Speedway">Dover Downs International Speedway</a>, now called Dover International Speedway is one of five <a href="Short%20track%20motor%20racing">short track</a>s to hold NASCAR races; the others are <a href="Bristol%20Motor%20Speedway">Bristol Motor Speedway</a>, <a href="Richmond%20International%20Raceway">Richmond International Raceway</a>, <a href="Martinsville%20Speedway">Martinsville Speedway</a>, and <a href="ISM%20Raceway">ISM Raceway</a>. The NASCAR race makes use of the track's standard configuration, a four-turn short track <a href="Oval%20track%20racing">oval</a> that is long. The track's turns are <a href="Banked%20turn">banked</a> at twenty-four degrees, and both the front stretch (the location of the finish line) and the backstretch are banked at nine degrees.
Qualifying.
Qualifying was rained out, thus <a href="Dale%20Jarrett">Dale Jarrett</a> would win the pole based on the 2001 NASCAR Winston Cup Series rulebook.
